intro: Crudia vouarana, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and it bears berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
